content: Taking regular breaks from sitting lowers your risk of type II diabetes.
Sitting for long periods increases your risk of type II diabetes.
Taking regular breaks from sitting lowers your risk of cardiovascular disease.
Sitting for long increases your risk of cardiovascular disease.
Taking regular breaks from sitting is associated with lower blood pressure.
Sitting for long periods is associated higher blood pressure.
Taking regular breaks from sitting is linked to better overall physical function.
Sitting for long periods is linked to worsened overall physical function.
Taking regular breaks from sitting is associated with less fat around the waist.
Sitting for long periods is associated with more fat around the waist.
